intro: Scabiosa ucranica, commonly known as the Ukrainian scabious, is a flowering plant native to Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Scabiosa ucranica is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and its ability to attract pollinators.
